metadata.ttm:title: Goods/Services
metadata.ttm:desc: After adding Negotiators, the Goods/Services page is your next destination. This step involves chosing the Special Item Numbers (SINs) to be included in the eOffer. A SIN is an identifier for the type of Goods or Services being provided. Each Offer may contain multiple SINs.

div.p: The "Goods and Services" page offers you the
opportunity to identify products or services your
firm can offer the government.
The types of products and services you wish to offer
are defined by "SINs" or, "Special Item Numbers."
SINs are sub-groups of similar products,
services, and solutions under a Schedule, More
information on individual SINs can be obtained from
GSA E-Library at www.gsaelibrary.gsa.gov.
On most solicitations, you will see an "Add SIN(s)"
drop down.
Occasionally, SINs are grouped together to
organize the expansive MAS Solicitations, in which
case you will need to select a SIN Group before
selecting the individual SIN to add.
Make your selection then click "Add SIN Details" to
move on to provide more information about the SIN.
You may notice some slight variations between this
video and your screen, as different SINs have
different requirements.
Begin on the ADD SIN Details screen by
identifying the appropriate NAICS code
associated with the SIN you are proposing.
You may have multiple options avavilable to
choose from and you should select the NAICS code that
is the closest match to the service you are
providing.
You will note that the drop down box contains
only the numbers available for different NAICS.
This can be difficult in that you may not know
which NAICS is most relevant to your industry.
For more information on particular NAICS codes,
visit the Census Bureau website.
Identify the scope of your SIN by indicating whether
you will provide domestic or overseas delivery.
As you prepared to respond to this solicitation, you
should have performed some projections as to how much
business you plan to do with the government.
One of the solicitation documents that you will
later be required to enter into the application is
the Commercial Sales Practice, or CSP-1.
In this form, you will have entered projected
sales for each of your "to be" SINs.
Take this information and populate it into the text
box in the "Estimated Sales" category.
In the "Commercial Delivery Schedule", you
will need to identify the time needed to respond to
orders.
The standard "after receipt of order" or A-R-O
response time is 30 days.
If you agree to this 30 day window for delivery,
click "yes."
Otherwise, indicate how many days the buyer can
expect delivery after receipt of order and, if
an expedited order is requested, how long will
it take you to deliver on such a request.
Depending on your Schedule and selected SIN you may
have additional questions.
For example, you may be required to answer if you
agree to participate in the Cooperative Purchasing
program.
You may select a corresponding "Federal
Supply Class", or FSC, or "Product Service Code", or
PSC, to which your SIN correlates.
After you have finished responding to all of the
questions click "Add This SIN" to move on.
Once you have added a SIN, you can review it and any
other SIN applied to the contract under the "Your
SINs" heading.
The "Edit" and "Delete" links allow you to
re-address SINs that you have already completed in
your offer.
Choose a preponderance of work after adding your
SINs.
Remember that it must be one of the Naics codes
that corresponds to a SIN chosen for the contract.
This should represent the majority of work that you
plan on doing with your contract.
Once you have finished identifying all of your
relevant SINs, click the "Save and Continue"
button.
